result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth A Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth A Clark
Current: 11236 N Riverside Rd, Hurley, WI 54534 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2016)
Prior: PO Box 443, 518 S Main St, Lohrville, WI 54970

Case called @ 1:58 p.m.  Defendant Kenneth A Clark in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Defendant Kenneth A Clark in custody.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Keberlein. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 18 months probation - Conditions: Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. In the event of a revocation the defendant is entitiled to 19 days CFTS. The court will allow the defendant to petition for early termination at the conclusion of 12 months provided the request is joined by the supervising agent. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 13, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:12 pm case called. Defendant Kenneth A Clark in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. NOH given.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Case called @ 3:24 p.m. Attorney Bryan D Keberlein in court.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to defendant's non appearance the court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference on April 30, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
